channel.title: Asides on Deuts Log
channel.description: Recent content in Asides on Deuts Log

item.title: @deuts@deuts.one 01JMGG1QY9YDA58EETKNTE7AFF
item.description: I give up on #Authelia. Why can’t it just come up with a very basic configuration for a very basic purpose like if you just want a simple username and password security for some of your services? Why complicate everything from the start? Any suggestion for alternatives please?
item.content:encoded: I give up on #Authelia. Why can’t it just come up with a very basic configuration for a very basic purpose like if you just want a simple username and password security for some of your services? Why complicate everything from the start? Any suggestion for alternatives please?

item.title: Maverick Hugo Theme
item.description:
Maverick Hugo Theme

Maverick is a minimal Hugo blog theme with introduction page and based on Listed by Ronalds Vilciņš. This Hugo theme features several content sections, front page, dynamic pages creation and a Github comment.
Another option for my future Hugo projects.
item.content:encoded:
Maverick Hugo Theme

Maverick is a minimal Hugo blog theme with introduction page and based on Listed by Ronalds Vilciņš. This Hugo theme features several content sections, front page, dynamic pages creation and a Github comment.
Another option for my future Hugo projects.

item.title: Tree
item.description:
Tree

An online tree-like utility for generating ASCII folder structure diagrams. Written in TypeScript and React.
Here’s an alternative to the tree app and command in Linux.
item.content:encoded:
Tree

An online tree-like utility for generating ASCII folder structure diagrams. Written in TypeScript and React.
Here’s an alternative to the tree app and command in Linux.

item.title: @deuts@deuts.one 01JMF6SMSMDV8125FDKFHMCCYM

item.title: @deuts@deuts.one 01JMDVJ3SPQR9N6MCJ9V3Z50R9
item.description: How to make sure that you’re getting the updated file in #PowerQuery, without the browser’s or server’s caching conflict: deuts.org/∞
item.content:encoded: How to make sure that you’re getting the updated file in #PowerQuery, without the browser’s or server’s caching conflict: deuts.org/∞

item.title: @deuts@deuts.one 01JMDTJXD7WAJVYWNM9FS5N4FD
item.description: #BDO now has a new online online banking website, the functionality of which is pretty much like its mobile app –> No Trust Accounts view or transactions (yet?). At least now it seems to accept auto-fill from my favorite password manager.
item.content:encoded: #BDO now has a new online online banking website, the functionality of which is pretty much like its mobile app –> No Trust Accounts view or transactions (yet?). At least now it seems to accept auto-fill from my favorite password manager.

item.title: Nanote - lightweight, selfhosted note-taking app
item.description:
Nanote - lightweight, selfhosted note-taking app

Lightweight, self-hosted note-taking application with filesystem-based storage so you maintain 100% portability of your notes.
Already tested this. Yes it’s simple. I think too simple. No frontmatter support whatsoever.
item.content:encoded:
Nanote - lightweight, selfhosted note-taking app

Lightweight, self-hosted note-taking application with filesystem-based storage so you maintain 100% portability of your notes.
Already tested this. Yes it’s simple. I think too simple. No frontmatter support whatsoever.

item.title: Memory notetaking app
item.description:
Memory notetaking app

A self-hosted editor and note taking app.
Another one of those note-taking apps.
item.content:encoded:

item.title: @deuts@deuts.one 01JM1FQ4QZAA1E56EMSEB43KWA
item.description: @reiver @deuts No, I suppose the 5GB are mostly the cached media from my timeline. They actually expire, 7 days I think by default.
item.content:encoded: @reiver @deuts No, I suppose the 5GB are mostly the cached media from my timeline. They actually expire, 7 days I think by default.

item.title: @deuts@deuts.one 01JM1FEZPSMH8AT0FVYNYE91BY
item.description:
@notnorm I use #Pushover for notification, and I have this in the URL: WATCHTOWER_NOTIFICATION_URL: pushover://shoutrrr:apptoken@userkey/?title=Green

I also have SKIP_TITLE set to true: WATCHTOWER_NOTIFICATION_SKIP_TITLE: true
item.content:encoded:
@notnorm I use #Pushover for notification, and I have this in the URL: WATCHTOWER_NOTIFICATION_URL: pushover://shoutrrr:apptoken@userkey/?title=Green

I also have SKIP_TITLE set to true: WATCHTOWER_NOTIFICATION_SKIP_TITLE: true
